title.rendered: Public Policy Hackathon by Kautilya Society, SLS Pune [March 21; Online; Cash Prizes Upto Rs. 15k]: Register by March 15!

content.rendered:
Online registrations are invited for the Public Policy Hackathon by Kautilya Society, SLS Pune. The application deadline is March 15, 2025!

About Symbiosis Law School, Pune

Symbiosis Law School (SLS), Pune, established in 1977, is renowned for providing world-class legal education. Initially affiliated with the University of Pune, it became a constituent of Symbiosis International University in 2002, gaining greater autonomy. As the flagship campus of Symbiosis International University, SLS Pune is recognized as one of India’s top law schools. Ranked among the top 10 by India Today Nielsen Survey in 2013, it also received the Bar Council of India’s Gold-star Award that year. With 38 years of excellence in teaching, learning, and research, SLS Pune continues to be a leader in legal education.

About the Public Policy Hackathon

The SLSP Public Policy Hackathon 2025 revolves around the theme: “Harnessing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the Public Sector: Balancing Innovation and Responsibility.”

Sub-themes for Abstract Submission

  • AI in Education – Transforming Learning and Administration
  • AI in Employment and Labour Markets – Navigating Workforce Disruptions and Job Creation
  • AI and Climate Change – Advancing Sustainability and Environmental Responsibility

Eligibility

  • Open to undergraduate and postgraduate students from all recognized universities and institutions.
  • Participants can register individually or in teams of 2-3 members. Cross-university teams are allowed.

Competition Format

  • Round 1: Abstract Submission (Deadline – March 16, 2025)
  • Round 2: Policy Paper Presentation (Virtual, March 21, 2025)

Important Dates

  • Last Date for Registration: March 15, 2025
  • Abstract Submission Deadline: March 16, 2025
  • Release of Problem Statement: March 19, 2025
  • Virtual Policy Paper Presentation: March 21, 2025
  • Declaration of Results: March 23, 2025

Why Participate?

  • Present your ideas before an expert panel of policymakers, legal professionals, and industry leaders.
  • Win cash prizes (Winner: ₹10,000 | Runner-up: ₹5,000).
  • Top 5 submissions will receive Certificates of Merit, and all shortlisted teams will get Certificates of Participation.
  • No Registration Fee.

How to Register?

Interested students can register using this link.

Contact

  • Email: ksslsp@symlaw.ac.in 
  • Krish Vikram: +91 99623 17223
  • Kriti Sood: +91 95993 00498

Deadline

The application deadline is March 15, 2025!

Click here to view the official notification for the Public Policy Hackathon by Kautilya Society, SLS Pune.
